etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Dana (1813–1895), geologist, zoologist, and teacher. From the name of H. Theodor Richter, German metallurgical chemist + -ite, after German Richterit

definitions: A ferromagnesian mineral of the amphibole group, occurring as elongated brown, yellow, red, or green crystals.

notes.text: Richterite is a silicate of sodium, calcium, magnesium, and (usually) iron(ii), Na₂Ca(Mg,Fe)₅Si₈O₂₂(OH)₂; it was formerly thought to contain manganese. Crystal system: monoclinic.
